unnormalised: So, you know how everyone's always saying “sarkar” this, “sarkar” that? It’s easy to forget there’s a whole army of folks behind the scenes making things tick, right? And honestly, keeping track of all the *Padma Shri* this and *IAS officer* that can get a bit confusing. So, let's break it down a bit, shall we?
normalised: So, you know how everyone's always saying “sarkar” this, “sarkar” that? It’s easy to forget there’s a whole army of folks behind the scenes making things tick, right? And honestly, keeping track of all the Padma Shri this and I-A-S officer that can get a bit confusing. So, let's break it down a bit, shall we?

unnormalised: First off, you've got your *Shri* and *Smt.* everywhere. It's like the default setting for adding a bit of respect. You'll see it slapped onto everything from nameplates at the *zilla parishad* to official announcements. And let’s be real, it’s polite, isn't it? Especially in India where *tehzeeb* still means something.

You'll see it slapped onto everything from nameplates at the zilla parishad to official announcements. And let’s be real, it’s polite, isn't it? Especially in India where tehzeeb still means something.

unnormalised: Then there’s the *Hon'ble* this and *Respected* that. These titles are generally reserved for high-ranking officials – think ministers, judges, that sort of big shot. You won't catch them calling your local *MLA* "Hon'ble," unless you're really trying to butter them up for some work, that is.

unnormalised: Don’t even get me started on the abbreviations. *IAS, IPS, IFS* – it’s practically an alphabet soup! You’ve got your *IAS* officers running districts, *IPS* officers keeping the peace and your *IFS* officers looking after our jungles. They all crack tough exams and then run half the country! Major respect, honestly. My cousin cleared *UPSC* last year, now he is posted as *SDM* in Bihar!

Major respect, honestly. My cousin cleared U-P-S-C last year, now he is posted as S-D-M in Bihar!

unnormalised: And then there's the *Sarpanch ji*, the head honcho of the village panchayat. They wield surprising power at the grassroots level. Honestly, they are the real face of the government for a lot of people living in rural areas. They can make or break your life!

unnormalised: Speaking of local, let’s not forget the *Ward Councillor*. They're your go-to person for anything from fixing potholes to dealing with overflowing drains. Gotta know who to call for your area, folks! My didi is contesting for *Ward no 7* in the next election.

unnormalised: Now, it might feel like just a whole bunch of fancy names and titles. But remember, each one carries a certain level of responsibility and authority. Whether it's the *Chief Secretary* making high-level policy decisions or the humble *Gram Sevak* helping villagers access government schemes, they all play a part in keeping the whole machine running.
